data.chText: 蜡；蜂蜡；动物蜡；植物蜡；石蜡
data.enText: a solid substance that is made from beeswax or from various fats and oils and used for making candles , polish, models, etc. It becomes soft when it is heated.
a soft sticky yellowish substance that is found in your ears

data.chText: 我惊慌失措，我大喊大叫——什么反应都有。
data.enText: I panicked, I cried─the whole ball of wax.
to remove hair from a part of the body using wax
to wax your legs/to have your legs waxed
to seem to get gradually bigger until its full form is visible

data.chText: 说话变得（热情、雄辩、伤感等）起来
data.enText: to become lyrical , etc. when speaking or writing

data.chText: 他对这家新餐馆的菜肴越说越来劲。
data.enText: He waxed lyrical on the food at the new restaurant.

data.chText: （力量、重要性等）兴衰枯荣，盛衰；阴晴圆缺
data.enText: to increase then decrease in strength, importance, etc. over a period of time

data.chText: 我惊慌失措，我大喊大叫——什么反应都有。
data.enText: I panicked, I cried─the whole ball of wax.

data.chText: （力量、重要性等）兴衰枯荣，盛衰；阴晴圆缺
data.enText: to increase then decrease in strength, importance, etc. over a period of time

tr: any of various substances of either mineral origin or plant or animal origin
they are solid at normal temperatures and insoluble in water

example: Sales were climbing after prices were lowered

value.def: Wax is a solid, slightly shiny substance made of fat or oil which is used to make candles and polish. It melts when it is heated.

example.ex: There were coloured candles which had spread pools of wax on the furniture...
example.tran: 彩色蜡烛在家具上留下一摊摊蜡油。

example.ex: She loved the scent in the house of wax polish.
example.tran: 她喜欢房子里打过蜡的味道。

value.def: If you wax a surface, you put a thin layer of wax onto it, especially in order to polish it.

example.ex: We'd have long talks while she helped me wax the floor.
example.tran: 她帮我给地板打蜡时我们谈了很久。

example.ex: ...all those Sundays spent washing and waxing the car.
example.tran: 那些用来洗车和给车上蜡的星期天

value.def: If you have your legs waxed, you have the hair removed from your legs by having wax put on them and then pulled off quickly.

example.ex: She has just had her legs waxed at the local beauty parlour...
example.tran: 她刚在当地一家美容院除了腿毛。

example.ex: She could go shopping, and wax her legs.
example.tran: 她可以去逛商店，顺便除一下腿毛。

value.def: Wax is the sticky yellow substance found in your ears.
If you say that someone, for example, waxes lyrical or waxes indignant about a subject, you mean that they talk about it in an enthusiastic or indignant way.

example.ex: He waxed lyrical about the skills and commitment of his employees...
example.tran: 他津津乐道于员工的技能和敬业精神。

example.ex: My mother waxed eloquent on the theme of wifely duty.

value.def: If something waxes and wanes, it first increases and then decreases over a period of time.

example.ex: Portugal and Spain had possessed vast empires that waxed and waned.
example.tran: 葡萄牙和西班牙都曾是经历了兴衰的大帝国。

trans: 巴西蜜蜡脱毛(一种女子阴部脱毛方式)
